physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Case 1: Triangular facies with upward slanting palpebral fissures, blepharophimosis, prominent nose, short philtrum, bilateral clinodactyly of the fifth finger, flat feet, hyperextensible knees, limited pronation/supination at the elbows, single caf√©-au-lait patch on abdomen. Case 2: Dysmorphic features including coarse facial gestalt, macroglossia, bitemporal indentation, malar hypoplasia, small ears with thickened helix.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Case 1: Height and weight remained below the 3rd percentile despite surgery for cardiac defects; hypoglycemia persisted. Case 2: Growth velocity has been stable, with height at 132.5 cm (5 cm above 99.6th percentile) and weight at 25.2 kg (95th percentile) at 5.8 years.
